results.title: Japanese boy: the story of Taro
results.creator_credit: William Deneen and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Uses the story of a Japanese boy, who learns the meaning of sacrifice, to reveal the attitudes, customs and problems of a farm family and to offer insights into the Japanese character. Suitable for primary level.

results.title: Japan: work and play in the land of the cherry blossom
results.brief_description: Brief look at varius aspects of Japanese life. Narration describing aspects of the culture is accompanied by footage of coastal villages involved in fishing and pearl harvesting followed by Tokyo urbanites attending flower shows and finally concluding with a description of geishas and footage of a geisha dance.

results.title: Japan: today and tomorrow
results.brief_description: Introducing Japan and showing the close relationship with Australia, which has developed over the last decade. Goods and industrial know-how are traded between the two countries - capital from Japan is used to develop our mineral resources while we supply her people with raw materials and food in ever increasing quantities.

results.title: Japan: the land, the people
results.brief_description: Describes how 83,000,000 people support themselves in a mountainous island nation, small in area, where arable land is extremely limited. The cultivaiton of rice, tea, silkworms and timber and the development of modern industries are shown, as well as Japan’s growth in the post World War II era.

results.title: Japan: an industrial nation at work
results.brief_description: Describes the industries of Japan, such as shipbuilding, automobile construction, the production of textiles and china-ware, the iron and steel industry, and the pearl industry. Points out the location of the largest industrial cities, and discusses the importance of raw materials which are essential to Japan’s manufacturing industry.

results.title: Japan: an historical overview [Colour]
results.brief_description: The major events in Japan’s long history, from the clan society of about 800BC to today’s parliamentary government. The influence of Buddhism and other cultural elements from Asia; the impact of Western technology; and how the shifting powers of priests, nobles, Shogun and Emperor have affected the destiny of this vigorous island nation.

results.title: Japan nearby
results.brief_description: A young woman doing research for her thesis on Japan - Australia Relations and a young man interested in architecture, share some of their knowledge and ideas with the audience while showing them aspects of traditional and modern Japanese life both in Australia and Japan.

results.title: Japan inc: lessons for North America?
results.creator_credit: Kalle Lasn, John Coney, John Taylor, Peter Jones and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Organization, discipline and productivity in Japan are on a scale not known in any other country of the world. For the 110 million people of Japan, survival means doing things together—a concept that has seen that nation automate and computerize at an unparalleled rate. Just how this level of achievement was reached is the subject of this absorbing documentary study of Japanese business and industry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kalle Lasn, John Coney, John Taylor, Peter Jones and ONF | NFB

results.title: Japan's surrender
results.brief_description: Documentary profiling the USA’s victory over Japan through atomic warfare during World War II and their eventual surrender signifying the end of the War. Edited by Eugene W. Castle.
